result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen L. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to maintain full-time employment.  If he should lose his employment, he must obtain full-time employment elsewhere.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Tabbitha Phelan or Olivia Basina.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.  Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take such prescriptions in manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from 1 pharmacy and report any changes to prescriptions within 72 hours, to his Agent.
Credit for 1 day, if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes:
Stay 4 months - to be used at the Agent's discretion upon application to the Court.
Court allows defendant 2 weeks to set up reporting date at Waupaca Co. Jail. (2/25/15)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
